Folders that I do not expect to need again, I move out of Thunderbird, still in mbox format, and put them in an archive folder on my local drive.

content: I wish you had shared your objective initially, to save all these posts. To make them viewable outside of thunderbird, here are steps - install the importexporttools addon - highlight all messages in folder or just highlight folder, rightclick, select the importexporttools option to export each message in whatever format the boss wants. PDF to view in PDF viewer, or HTML to view in browser. This forces the boss to take ownership of whatever he/she gets. - then, in future, do the same for each new message to save. - there is no need to zip anything.
creator: davidsk

mbox files can also be opened in a text editor and searched.

content:
As in all my useful question & answers, I provide full instructions, so if you have already created a 'chrome' folder and 'userChrome.css' file then you may only need to copy the code.

This is the code I used. You can modify the colours to be whatever you desire. You may find this link useful for colour selection: https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_mixer.asp

First - Please check in Thunderbird to see if a setting needs switching on.

  • Settings > General
  • Scroll to bottom and click on 'Config Editor' button
  • In search type : legacy
  • look for this line: toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets
  • If it is set as 'false' :
  • click on the far right arrow type icon to toggle from 'false' to say 'TRUE'

Now Do this: In Thunderbird

  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • in 'Application Basics' - Profile Folders - click on 'Open Folder' (Windows OS)

A new window opens showing the contents of your 'profile name' folder.

  • Exit Thunderbird now. This is important.

I'm going to give the full instructions because I do not know if people already know how to create and use a userChrome.css file.

  • In the 'profile name' folder create a new folder and call it 'chrome'. The spelling is important - note it is all lower case.
  • Then open a simple text editor program such as 'Notepad'.
  • Copy all the text between the lines below and paste it into 'Notepad'. 
@import url("chrome://messenger/content/unifiedtoolbar/unifiedToolbarWebextensions.css"); @namespace html url("http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml");  /* color of unread in thread pane*/ #threadTree tbody [data-properties~="unread"] { color: #2492d1 !important;  }  /*In threads view - collapsed thread - top level needs to be bold if thread contains unread mail.*/ #threadTree tbody .children.collapsed[data-properties~="hasUnread"]   :where(td, .subject-line) {   text-decoration: none !important;   font-weight: bold !important;   color:  var(--thread-pane-unread-color) !important; }
  • Save the file as 'userChrome.css' - note the spelling of this is important - all lower case except the C.
  • Save it in the 'chrome' folder. - see attached image as guide.

Check that file really is called 'userChrome.css' and not 'userChrome.css.txt' - it has to be saved as a Cascading Style Sheet (css) and not a text document. So if you see 'userChrome.css.txt' - no problem - just rename it by removing the .txt - you will get ask are you sure as it may effect things - just say yes because you really do want to do it.

Start Thunderbird
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
If you want to see other 'userChrome.css' fixes - it says version 115* but code still applies. How to move the 'Menu Bar' above the 'Unified toolbar':

  • https://support.mozilla.org/bs/questions/1422908

content: To merge message folders, - install the importexporttools addon if not already done - highlight a folder to be merged from old profile - righclick and select importexport option to export all messages in folder> in EML format - save the messages in a temporary folder in Windows - now, highlight the folder in new profile to accept the exported messages - again, rightclick and select the importexport option to import EML messages - select the folder in which you exported the messages. - delete the messages from that temporary windows folder - repeat the above steps for all folders to be merged.

content: You need to have all folders in thunderbird first. Do do that - exit thunderbird - locate the desired mail folders in the old profile, probably in the Mail folder for POP accounts and Mail\Local Folders for local folders. - copy the files, such as inbox, sent (but NOT the msf files) to the Mail\Local Folders folder in new Profile, being sure not to overwrite any with same name - now, start thunderbird and do the prior steps I suggested. Since your intent is to merge, what the steps do is export message folders into EML files. - after exporting, then import into the desired folder for merging - repeat steps as needed

content: The export of mbox that creates the EML files will serve you well, as you will be able to see each message as a separate file in the Windows File Explorer view. I suggest exporting each TB message folder into separate Windows folders so that you keep everything separate. Then, when you do the import, those separate messages will be merged into the Thunderbird folder and you can then review to see them there. This process puts you in full control.

content:
I think your domain, renthappily.co.uk, is hosted by Plesk, and if so, the settings are:

incoming IMAP server: renthappily.co.uk, port 143, connection security = none, authentication = Encrypted password, User Name = email address

outgoing SMTP server: renthappily.co.uk, port 25, connection security = none, authentication = Encrypted password, User Name = email address

'Encrypted password' and security = none are quite rare.

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content:
Buongiorno, ecco le informazioni che sono riuscito a recuperare:

Versione di Thunderbird -> 128.9.1esr (64 bit) Versione del sistema operativo -> Windows 11 Home; Versione 24H2; Build 26100.3476 Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.) -> Gmail Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP) -> imap Estensioni installate-> trovo la pagina per installarne ma quella per rilevare quelle già presenti Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird -> nessun errore Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili) -> Norton 360

Grazie e cordiali saluti
creator: massimiliano.grana

content: Sarebbe utile se potessi allegare uno screenshot di una email in cui si verifica questo problema. Se il messaggio contiene informazioni private, oscurale prima di caricare l'immagine.

content: Thunderbird is only an agent between you and your email provider. As such, thunderbird is returning message from your email provider that the password is wrong. The actual problem may be an incorrectly configured server, spelling error in email address, or possibly that your email provider uses a unique password for email clients. If you post screenshot of your incoming server settings pane, someone here may have suggestions. Thank you.

content:
I do not think it has anything to do with POP or IMAP.

I think your replies will be threaded with the rest of the conversation that are part of. This is particularly problematic for those that try and reuse old emaik for new conversations because the replies are filed in a thread that is perhaps 5 years old when they come in because the mail is linked to the original email.

This image shows a number of emails threaded. That is what the > in the message list means. That the entry has sub messages

The above is a subset of the same list, with one of the threads expended by clicking on the >

This is where I think your missing emails are hiding, in a collapsed thread. In a perfect world, and in this one, I would encourage you to never click reply on a message and then start deleting stuff. Click on new message instead and simply add an address. Every email you ever send has it's address stored in collected addresses, so you should be able to address a new email without drama.

Knowing that those the send mail by reusing old email never change their ways, I suggest you read the support document linked and change the defaults view of your folder. It will not end the frustration of those you correspond with, but it will fix your immediate problem. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird#


.

content:
The image has Folder Pane and it's got only 'Local Folders' displaying, so this means you have set up a Pop account as a deferred account more commonly know as 'Global Inbox'

How to check :

  • In Account Settings
  • Select 'Server Settings' for pop account
  • Click on 'Advanced' button

You would have this selected:

  • selected: 'Inbox for different account' and 'Global Inbox (Local Folders)'
  • Selected checkbox : 'Include this server when getting new mail'


If search says email is in Inbox AND you can then open it by clicking on the search result. AND threading is not enabled then it sounds like a filter of some sort is operating.

I can see from the image that 'Quick Filter' does not have any icon selected. So it does not look like the culprit.

Please check you have the following which is ideal for general use.

  • View > Folders > 'All'
  • View > Threads > 'All'

Now I've had a thought about replies in a specific topic with a specifc person not displaying and wonder if that is because they are set up as 'ignored'

  • Please also select 'View > Threads' > 'ignored threads'

It's very easy to set up an ignore thread or subthread by using the keyboard 'K' key at wrong time. If you have inadvertantly selected an email to be ignored OR replies to an email to be ignored then it should now display and in the 'threads' column header you should see a red circle type of icon. Right click on that email and you should see the 'Ignored thread' or 'ignore subthread' option selected - so click on it to remove the setting.

See more help here on ignored threads and subthreads. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/ignore-threads
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
It would help to know what incoming and outgoing server settings you are using. User name in both of the following would be your full email address, so you can redact the username, but display everything else.

  • Account Settings
  • select name of pop account
  • click on 'Edit SMTP server' button
  • Post an image showing settings
  • then click on OK to close
  • select 'Server Settings' for pop account.
  • Post image to show incoming settings

content:
re :Your email has been blocked because the sender is unauthenticated.

You have the wrong settings in your SMTP.

SMTP server settings

  • DEscription: healfood
  • Server Name: mail.islandnet.com

Either:

  • Port: 465
  • Connection SEcurity: SSL/TLS

OR

  • Port: 587
  • Connection SEcurity: STARTTLS

Authentication Method: Normal Password (you had select Encrypted Password which is wrong) Username: enter full email addess
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
re : incoming server settings- you are not using a secure method.

You need to edit the incoming server setting and get them up to date. I think your settings may have been set up a long time ago and you need to get them up to date. I have found all my information off the islandnet.com website.

  • In 'Account Settings'
  • Select 'Server Settings' for the pop account
  • Server name: mail.islandnet.com
  • Port: 995
  • Username: Full email address
  • Connection Security: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password


After fixing the Incoming server settings and the SMTP server settings - Exit Thunderbird. Wait a few moments for all background processes to complete and then restart Thunderbird. This should ensure you are now connecting and sending securely.

Then see if you can send to a gmail email address.

creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Messages from islandnet.com to gmail users are rejected. A message says that the sender must authenticate with either SPF or DKIM.

Google provides explanations and directions here: https://support.google.com/a/answer/81126?visit_id=638811410022637736-1720381163&rd=1#authentication

The gist of it seems to be: "If you use an email service provider, verify that they authenticate your domain’s email with SPF and DKIM."

So it seems to me that healfood (OP) needs to talk with his e-mail service provider about SPF and DKIM.

These are things that I know little about. Just trying to help in some way.
